metadata.feature_description: Provides visual editing interface for content layout configuration in page edit mode.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Display edit controls in edit mode

steps.action: Logged in as superuser and entered edit mode by clicking Edit button
steps.expected: Edit mode should be enabled with pane labels, dashed borders, and resize handles visible
steps.actual: Edit mode enabled successfully. Pane labels (F30A_Pane1-4, 9977_Pane1-4), dashed borders around columns, and resize handles between columns are all visible

steps.action: Scrolled to view ContentLayout module columns in edit mode
steps.expected: ContentLayout 4-column structure visible with edit controls
steps.actual: Four-column ContentLayout visible with dashed borders, resize handles (gray circular dots between columns), and pane labels clearly showing edit mode UI controls

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Hide edit controls in view mode

steps.action: Exited edit mode by navigating away (edit mode was unlocked)
steps.expected: Edit controls should be hidden in view mode
steps.actual: All edit controls hidden - no dashed borders, no resize handles, no pane labels, no edit bar. Only clean content grid visible (TELEVISIONS, WEARABLES, TABLETS, LAPTOPS, etc.)

steps.action: Entered edit mode and observed column heights in ContentLayout
steps.expected: All columns should have equal height matching the tallest column
steps.actual: All four columns in the ContentLayout module have equal height despite having different content sizes. The _adjustColumnHeight function equalizes heights to match the tallest column (minimum 110px)

steps.action: Hovered over ContentLayout panes to trigger action menu and size viewers
steps.expected: Size viewers should appear showing column percentages, and module action menus for child modules should be visible
steps.actual: Size viewers appeared showing percentages (38%, 12%, 25%, 25%). Module action menu with Admin/Move options visible for child modules (e.g., Wearables module 359). Pane label F30A_PANE2 displayed on hover

steps.action: Verified drag state handling code implementation and observed CatchDragState class setup
steps.expected: ContentLayout should have drag state handling configured with CatchDragState class
steps.actual: Code verification confirms: CatchDragState class added to ContentLayout container, CSS styles for .dragging state defined (dashed border, pane hiding), and drag event handlers properly configured for mousedown/mouseup and dragstart/dragend events

steps.expected: ContentLayout columns should display in 4-column grid at desktop width
steps.actual: Four-column layout displayed correctly with all edit controls visible at 1280px viewport width

steps.expected: ContentLayout should adapt to narrow viewport while maintaining edit controls
steps.actual: Layout compressed to fit 480px width. Columns adjusted and content reflowed. Edit controls (dashed borders, resize handles, edit toolbar) remained visible and functional at mobile width

observations: Drag state handling is implemented in code (LayoutEditor.js lines 320-357) but requires manual drag interactions to fully test the visual feedback during drag operations
Size viewers showing column percentages appear on hover over resize handles, providing visual feedback for column width adjustments
ContentLayout modules containing child modules have their module actions removed (EditDisabled class added), while child modules retain their own action menus
The resize handles between columns use jQuery UI resizable with min-width constraint of 105px (colMinWidth)
Column height adjustment runs on a 20ms interval to detect and synchronize height changes across all columns
